text: Christopher Craft (17 November 1939 â€“ 20 February 2021) was a British racing driver who competed in many different forms of motor sport. Craft was born in Porthleven, Cornwall. He began his career in 1962, with a Ford Anglia and became known as a leading saloon car racer. He moved to sports cars from 1968, with a Chevron and then joined forces with Alain de Cadenet to drive his Porsche 908 and McLaren M8C. Craft died on 20 February 2021, aged 81.Chris Craft ==References== Category:1939 births Category:2021 deaths Category:British racecar drivers Category:People from Cornwall
title: Chris Craft (racing driver)
